snippet: Iran’s emissary to a United Nations human rights meeting said he hoped the case against Jason Rezaian would soon be dropped.
abstract: Senior Iranian emissary hints that Iranian authorities might be prepared to free Jason Rezaian, Washington Post correspondent who has been inexplicably imprisoned and kept virtually incommunicado since July 22.

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Iran’s emissary to a United Nations human rights meeting said he hoped the case against Jason Rezaian would soon be dropped.

headline.main: Iran Hints at Possible Release of Washington Post Correspondent Soon
headline.print_headline: Iran Hints at Possible Release of Washington Post Correspondent Soon

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
